\title{Ores and Materials}

Galena can be found in largish clumps no higher than 46 meters above bedrock.
Both silver and lead can be extracted from it.
Silver is used to reflect sunlight, and lead is used as a conductor.
Furnaces smelt galena into only silver.
However, if smelted in a \link{slagfurnace}{Slag Furnace},
it will produce both silver and lead ingots.

\topic{tile.factorization.ResourceBlock.SILVERORE}

\leftpage

Dark iron ore is an unusual metal.
It is found in craters in the bedrock,
and is clearly not the product of any natural process.
This material is uniquely suitable for for \link{servo}{servos} and other automata.

\topic{tile.factorization:darkIronOre}

\leftpage

Diamond Shards are produced by exploding blocks
of diamond with TNT.
This produces 18 shards.
They are used to make \link{lacerator}{Lacerators}.
